website_summaries.verdict: Logitech's laser mouse is accurate and cordless, with long battery life. What more could you want in a mouse?

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse... 2006 Purchase just now wearing out...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these in 2006... over the last cpl months both have finally started to have issues with the left click... opened them up and the contact point on the housing has worn down so you really have to press to trigger the switch... Im going to rig it and try to get some more life outta them... Best mice I ever had... I'm getting another mouse (Logitech) Just in case my Frankenstein rebuild of the MX1000 fails :)
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J. Strauss

customer_reviews.title: The best mouse ever!
customer_reviews.text: I had used the original Fast-RF version of this mouse until it died. I tried the next 2 generations that replaced it, and they all had issues that detracted from the experience of using the original MX1000. I finally found an MX1000 on Amazon, but when it arrived, it was a BlueTooth version of that venerable mouse. I was happily surprised to find that it shared all of the reasons that made me love the original MX1000, and the BlueTooth actually makes it feel even snappier in gaming. No way to actually prove that it responds faster, but it does feel that way. I use it for video editing, gaming, and everyday life. Can't recommend it highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: J. Karczmit

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased November 19, 2005. Many computers have come and gone but continue to use this mouse every day. Other than the occasional battery change, it has worked perfect!
customer_reviews.author: William J. Maxam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new mouse because I had the cordless duo and was looking for an upgrade. I stumbled across this mouse and it's amazing. I have had no problems at all with it. 100% accurate, it is a night and day difference from my old mouse. If you are thinking about getting this mouse, then I am telling you to think no more, buy it now, you will not regret it. I have it running perfectly on Windows XP SP2, P4, and 1 Gig of ram. I use Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Flash, Visual Studio.NET 2003 a ton usually about 9+ hours a day, so I am constantly using a mouse and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jourdan

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse, don't forget to plug it in twice
customer_reviews.text: There is one other review that says "mouse died after two weeks", and that also happened to me ... I eventually found out the reason is because as well as plugging the base station into the computer USB port, you have to plug it into a power outlet (or the mouse doesn't recharge). While this sounds stupid, it's the first mouse I've ever owned that needed to be plugged directly into power and there is nothing shouting at you that you must do this (you have to look at the diagram for "how to plug the mouse in") and the plug is easy to miss in the packaging. However, after solving that problem the mouse works very well.
customer_reviews.author: James Antill

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: Bought and original back in 2005 and loved it. So much so I wore the left mouse button out. Final found one here on Amazon and decided to purchase. When I got the mouse it was a little dirty but I cleaned it up with some sanitizer. I've had the mouse for about three weeks now and no issues. If you've never owned a logitech mouse before this one will spoil you. They just don't make them like this anymore. The best mouses I've ever used. No exaggeration. Good buy at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P

customer_reviews.title: Not bad product
customer_reviews.text: It is ok to use but I won't buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Cj Wang

customer_reviews.title: Not a significant  performance increase over optical
customer_reviews.text: Mouse works well as I would expect from logitech, who has never disappointed me with any of thier products. It has a great feel, holds it's charge and was simple to install. I have 2 negative things to say. The first is that I have not seen much of an improvement over the optical mouse I was using with my Logitech MX700 desktop. The second is that the scroll wheel feels a little flimsy compared to the old one. The best improvement over the older designs is the left/right scroll wheel. Overall I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JC315

customer_reviews.title: Critique
customer_reviews.text: The speed is wonderful. The software supplied was terrible. The update to the supplied software was terrible as well. Had to go to Customer Support just to get it to work. Customer Support was great and solved all problems albeit I should not have had to do so. The battery is great and lasts ever so long. The left & right buttons are too weak. The receiver/transmitter is not as good as my MX700 as the mouse looses contact here and there. Fairly good job but you only deserve 3 1/4 Stars
customer_reviews.author: Len Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mouse for along time and enjoy it. It has alot of controls at your fingertips, so you don't have to move around the screen as much, less hand movement. I really like the back/forward and document flip buttons. There is one draw back with this product. I'm sure Logitech made it's size for the average hand. I have small hands and little fingers, so if you do too, expect to have to reposition your hand at times to reach some of the controls. Children would have problems too. Logitech should investiage this, and model more than one size. I would have rated it 5 star otherwise. But, I still recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time Logitech fan, having had many of their products which I've found superior. My previous mouse was a MX500. The problem with the MX1000 was a jittery cursor. The thing was not stable, it jumped around all the time, not by a lot but enough that I had to concentrate on positioning it in a box or whatever. Just not nearly as stable as the MX500. Finally decided to change to a MS Explorer 2.0 Wireless IntelliMouse (on sale) which I like much better. Hate to admit this as I'm one to avoid MS if I can. On the plus side the battery was excellent, lasting a long time before needing recharge.
customer_reviews.author: B Doeden

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't hesitate buying this one!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse for about a month and i use it on Mac G4 computers. This mouse is so quick I have to turn the sensitvity down to 2nd to last setting. Easy to program, ergonmics are great, rapid charging and the charge lasts a long time. This was well designed with a great price. This is the one to beat. It ships only with PC software so Mac users will have to go on Logitechs website and download it. BUY IT, YOU'LL LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: agypsy

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse!  Lots of Features!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my MX 1000 from Amazon, with the free shipping I saved $20 over Best Buy. I'm upgrading from a previous Logitech wireless mouse. It worked well but I was tired of changing batteries and wanted more features. Right away, you can tell this mouse is great! It has a very comfortable feel (right handed) and moves nicely. The button placement is great, and the software allows for a lot of customization. I upgraded the software online to the newest version with no problems. The base has a very small AC adapter that fits easily on your power strip between other plugs. The mouse tracks very well, and is very well designed. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Adam K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great. Very smooth, precise and ergonomic. All buttons are programabale through Logitech's included software. For Mac, one must download the software for it is not bundled in this package. Not sure if in PC, but in MAC the horizontal scroll function can not be programed. This is the only bad thing I have to say about this fantastic mouse. Worth the money. Too bad they don't make this mouse for bluetooth on MAC.
customer_reviews.author: Flat Magnitude

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  Product
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this mouse. I am a programmer and as such I require a great deal of precision to position graphical elements. This mouse gives me that excellent precision and it is very responsive. The rechargeable stand is a great idea. No more replacing batteries! The mouse turns off automatically in a few seconds if you don't use it, so there is almost no power usage when you are not using it. It wakes up very quickly without a noticeable lag. I've wasted money on mouses before but this was a very good investment. Roger
customer_reviews.author: Roger McCook

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse ever
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a MX700 (2nd best mouse EVER) and I love this mouse. I hear there a problems assigning the extra buttons in games but I'm sure you can do this by changing to buttons to execute keyboard shortcuts. BESIDES THAT, ERGONOMICS AND PRECISION ARE ***PERFECT***. Also the charger and battery indicator are great. This mouse is VERY easy to pick up during fast paced games. The only complaint I have is the forward and back buttons are a bit harder to click than on the MX700.
customer_reviews.author: Brad C.

customer_reviews.title: Super Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Truly and excellent product....perfect performance and the batteries are seeming to last forever....I had a 60 buck MicroSoft unit that I dumped becuse of the batteries dying every few weeks....this unit has rechargeable batteries and it's own charging standing....beutiful molded grip and super control of all the movements supplied....buy again? Absolutely......might buy another for a backup unit....
customer_reviews.author: dikw

customer_reviews.title: Laser mouse a relief
customer_reviews.text: I previously had another wireless mouse and it seemed to eat up AA batteries and the charger didn't work well. The main reason I bought this mouse was the fact I didn't need to change the battery. I was dissapointed for two reasons; The first was the mouse is not completely compatible with my KVM switch. The second the mouse configuration software would not always allow me to configure the mouse when after losing the config settings when switching computers. The extra features are OK, but I don't use them. I just wanted to be able to use the scroll functions and not change batteries all the time. This mouse satisfied those requirements.
customer_reviews.author: weeder

customer_reviews.title: Great All Around
customer_reviews.text: This laser cordless mouse tracks much, much better than any previous optical mouse I've used, and I have a challenging surface with a granite desk. The batteries seem to last a long time, and I recharge it overnight maybe every 2 weeks in the convenient charger. I was worried that it looked bulky in the pictures, but it is actually very lightweight and so easy to use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy use after the first week without returning it to the charger. I bought this as I use a similar one at work. Comfortable and may never buy another style of mouse again. (Not a heavy gamer, but data entry). Side scrolling with the wheel is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best mouse I've ever used, and I've used many mice over 27 years of computer programming and PC usage, both in games and office applications. The feel of the mouse is solid and dependable. I prefer it to the G7 gaming mouse (sorry Logitech). As I said in my review of the G7, the other mouse has 2 batteries so you can use one while the other recharges and it is quicker an more responsive. This one has more features and, as I said above, feels better in my hand (although your "mileage may vary").
customer_reviews.author: John H. Austin Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Logitec MX1000 Laser Cordless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is great but has two things that I am not satisfied with. One is that the scoll button has no resistence to rotation so the screen will bounce back and forth when the button is released. There should be a bit of ristence to rotation. The charge maintained on the battery is short. It needs to have about 3 more hours of time when fully charged. It runs down after about 4 hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Donald M. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Better than an optical mouse, sort of
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the laser mouse because I used my cordless mouse on a wood surface, which I didn't know is not the best surface for an optical mouse. The laser mouse does much better in terms of accuracy,but the fancy buttons on left side of the mouse stopped working after one day and so I was reduced to the old double clicking to get into programs. It's an okay product, but not worth $60.
customer_reviews.author: T. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is the best mouse I have ever used, period. The ergonomic design has helped my aching wrist and the multitude of buttons, including ones that will take you "back" and "forward" while your browsing the web are amazing. The battery power is great, I usually only need to charge it once a week and the rest of the time I only plug the receiver into my laptop and put away the charging cords. It does take a day or two to get used to, but you can use the software that comes with it to modify its use to your liking.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: *****ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!*****
customer_reviews.text: Something short, simple, and to the point. I've had this mouse for a few months and so far have charged it TWICE! I am a computer gamer and an EVERQUEST FREAK so it definitely gets a workout. This mouse has performed perfectly with NO PROBLEMS WHATSOEVER! I find it very easy to fast forward and scroll web pages and the charge time when drained is very reasonable! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS MOUSE!!
customer_reviews.author: Scordra

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Its takes about a week to get used to all the feature/functions, but after you do you will be hard pressed to use a standard mouse. The wireless range appears to be very good and tracking seem accurate as well. Nice ergonomics and button feel. Only gripe is the high price. I want a second for my home office, but only if the price comes down a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Logitech MX1000
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints with this mouse except Logitech including crapware like musicmatch, ebay toolbar, etc that you need to opt out of during install. Battery life is great lasting weeks on a single charge. The extra buttons and functionality I'm still getting used to. The utility is very easy to use. I had one other wireless mouse that would always loose sync. This one works everytime. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Just got my new Logitech MX Laser mouse this morning. Charged it on it's base and now am using it. So far, it is the smoothest operating mouse I've ever used. My old mouse was an A4Tech wireless mouse and it worked fine. This new logitech mouse is like the difference between an old clunker and a limo. Very comfortable for my hand-my hands are not large. The only thing I can find to critizize on this mouse is the wheel-it feels a lil bit chinzy compared to the rest of the mouse-but it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: 6 Years of continuos usage, still WORKING. Flawless design.
customer_reviews.text: After more than 5-6 years of usage, the mouse still hold charge. I do notice the charges go out quickly, but I definitely got my money worth it. Up today, I am still using this mouse. However, not for gaming anymore, but for daily usage.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Logitech MX1000 Laser Cordless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mouse for years now. It works as well today as when I first bought it. I have charged this mouse 100's of times without any problems. It fits well in my big hand, do not know how it would be in yours It is a great product
customer_reviews.author: jimmyanne

customer_reviews.title: Even better than expected
customer_reviews.text: With one month of use so far, I'm very happy I bought this. The battery lasts at least a week, or forever if you always charge it when you're done. I really like the heft, and don't see why some think it is too heavy. Right-handers will find this really comfortable. The only drawback is that Mac users wanting to use more than two buttons and a scroll wheel will need to purchase either USB Overdrive or QuicKeys to enable use of the other buttons.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Better than its competition
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a replacement for my purchase due to a battery failure. The first mouse amazon sent me was not holding its charge. Once I let amazon know they shipped me a new one the next day. The mouse works perfect. It is a little large so if you have a fairly small hand do not bother. However, most adults should be just fine. Its tracking capabilities it absolutely phenomenal. Once you get used to them the navigation buttons are also very useful. If I had not had to replace the first one I would have given this mouse an easy 5 stars. Overall, a great mouse that I will be using for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Suigeneris

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade for MX700, very good mouse
customer_reviews.text: This was a good upgrade to my aging MX700 (still kicking, bought it soon after it came out). Feels a bit lighter, and the fit of the mouse is slighter better (your hand is more cradled by the thumb rest). Tracking, even in FPS games, is excellent, on par with wired mice such as the MX510. On wood grained desks, its much more sensitive to surface movements. Whereas my MX700 would occasionaly miss a beat, this picks up every movement. And on my cuttered work surface, wireless for mice is the way to go. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: theatrus

customer_reviews.title: Like the energizer bunny......this just keeps going!
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not.......my hubby still uses this and even though I offered to buy him a new one......he likes this one and refuses another until this dies! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Marie

customer_reviews.title: Worked Fine, Odd Shape and Weight
customer_reviews.text: I disliked this mouse. It worked fine and connected with the iMac easily. But it's an oddly-shaped mouse, and very heavy. Beginning to use it, I enjoyed the absence of a wire. But by the end of only an hour, my wrist and forearm were aching -- and my wrist and forearm never ache. I put the mouse back in its box and returned it pronto.
customer_reviews.author: Alonzo

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had the MX1000 since last September (2006), and it's everything it says it is. Even though my family and I put it through its paces for hours every day, the rechargable battery runs for days without recharging. The wireless feature has never interfered with my wireless network, and the multiple button features work great. I highly recommend the MX1000 to anyone looking for a dependable, multi-featured, rechargable, wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: John WilcoxTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: wonderful mouse
customer_reviews.text: i previously had a logitech mx700 optical mouse, which served me well, but met its time after 3 years of service. i was very fond of that mouse, but like the mx1000 even more. the mx1000 is even more ergonomic than the mx700, and the tilt wheel is a great feature. the sensitivity is also unmatched. it actually took me a while to get used to how sensitive it was, as the tiniest movement triggered the mouse. i'd recommend this mouse to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: haversham

customer_reviews.title: So far the best mouse I have ever used..
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has all of the features I needed. It can be programmed to do what you want with each of the buttons. I have found this to be very functional and have also found the laser to be very responsive and accurate. I have never enjoyed using a mouse as much as I have this one. I look forward to many years with this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Lady M.

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: It worked and did its job. However, the mouse had problems sitting in the charging cradle; I would all ways have to play around to get it to charge. Though, my LAN buddies also had this mouse but did not have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: mlp

customer_reviews.title: Cordless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is fantastic. I bought 3 of them for use on my Macs. It has been flawless & a great time saver. Everyone loves them. My only Complaint is Logitech had a rebate on these & they never sent me my money. They sent me a postcard telling me I didn't send them the correct box bar codes. I sent them the only ones on the box. So, Logitech screwed me 3 time. The mouse is good, but Logitech sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Bensen

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse period.
customer_reviews.text: I am software pro and use mouse non-stop for 8 hours (sometime more) a day. It is perfect in shape and weight. If you have problem with back and forward button in firefox just change both button to generic and you are all set. Other buttons are well place and battery life is 1 week without charge for 8 hours a day use. Also I don't have change batteries (with media mouse it was a problem) forever..
customer_reviews.author: fungame

customer_reviews.title: good mouse used for four years.
customer_reviews.text: I used this mouse for four years, one at home and the other one at office. I reconfig all the buttons to fasten all my windows operations. I like it very much. One of the mice used for four years reaches its battery life. I will switch to MX1100.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I don't think I'll ever use another mouse!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that's happened to my mouse in the last 2 years has been the little feet on the bottom of it coming off. I don't think I'll ever find a mouse as good as this one though. The MX revolution was nice as well, but it lacks a middle click which I use in everything including games, so this one still reigns king, as nice as the fast scrolling and app switch wheel are.
customer_reviews.author: M. Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse for my husband for Valentine's Day. I wasn't sure if we would like it or not...but we both love it! It stays charged for many days at a time. After using it we don't ever want to go back to a plain 'ol mouse. I plan on buying one for my computer now.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Geek

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The only problems is it doesn't bark at you before the battery is spent which takes about 2 or 3 weeks. If you remember to park it in it's little recharge caddy once a week, it's perfect. Otherwise you're forced to take a 2 minute break while it gets enough juice to last a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best rechargable mouse
customer_reviews.text: It makes a lot of sense to use a rechargable mouse for office use and this one has great ergonomics good range and handy charging indicators. It is a bit pricey compared to the competition but one cannot realy compare, as the MX1000 is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything it's cracked up to be.
customer_reviews.text: I have thoroughly enjoyed this mouse so far. It is accurate, and VERY comfortable to use all day long. The design is attractive and non-obtrusive on your desktop. The only problem now is, I hate my mouse at home! (This one's for the office)
customer_reviews.author: P. Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wireless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mouse for about a week now and it has performed flawlessly. Setup was very easy. All the buttons were preprogrammed to the functions I wanted. The accuracy is unmatched. It hasn't given me one problem. I would recommend this mouse to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brandano

customer_reviews.title: very, very nice mouse
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I decided on this mouse. Very long battery life (can go days and days w/o a recharge and I've never run out of battery at an inopportune time), good ergonomics, good solid construction. Couldn't be happier w/ it.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  I love it
customer_reviews.text: I had some concerns before buying because some reviews said the mouse was sluggish. Perhaps they didn't know how to adjust the mouse controls in Windows. This mouse is awesome. Very comfortable and I love the short cut buttons. Just buy it, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Pawelko

customer_reviews.title: Logitech MX1000 Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant to buy this mouse as it had received mixed reviews. So far it has been working as promised and I have had no problems. With the great price from amazon and the rebate, the price was the same as similar mice without all the features.
customer_reviews.author: STPUD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cordless mouse!
customer_reviews.text: While I dont use all of the features, and have been burned by the poor quality of a logitech cordless in the past, I decided to try this new laser version. What an improvement! The tracking is phenominal and feels great in your hand. About the only downside I have experienced is that it takes up most of the mousepad I use (with the gel wrist rest). I have adjusted the pointer speed to overcome this - so its really a minor inconvenience. Good job Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: B. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Logitech MX1000 Laser
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Now that I have a wireless mouse, I'm not too sure how and why I lived with a mouse bound to a box! The Logitech is extremely precise in movement. I bought this one for work... I'm going to buy another for home.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Cobban

customer_reviews.title: and it is still working great.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for several years, and it is still working great.
customer_reviews.author: Rennie G. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Best You Can Buy
customer_reviews.text: It's such a shame that Logitech discontinued this multi-featured model some years ago, but these suppliers seem to have some left - for which I am grateful !! The only thing that went wrong with my last one was that the rubber coating wore off where the thumb rests and this didn't affect its efficiency. It took three weeks to arrive but within their estimated timescale. Most pleased with the mouse and their service
customer_reviews.author: Clive Laycock

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth It!!
customer_reviews.text: After thinking newer is better ~ I was wrong! The Logitech G7 is an O.K. device, but is not near as user friendly as the MX 1000. This is the 3rd one that I've purchased and love all of them. I've even purchased this last one for my 11 year old daughter. The charging stand is a definite plus. It eliminates scrounging for a AA battery at 3:00am when you're trying to finish a project! For right now, this hands down is the best mouse on the market. Kevin Kennedale, TX
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is decent, but the easy stand makes it perfect. the ergonomic design almost perfectly fits my mousing style, and the buttons feel framiliar and easy to use. the only issue I have is that by default, clicking in the mouse wheel preforms a different task than normal, but that's easily corrected in the options. I'm gonna keep this mouse untill something more awesome than mice is invented
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: You need this mouse
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, accurate, reliable and comfortable pointing device. It works on my clear plastic covered desk and every other surface I've tried. You won't be disappointed. I've had mine for a month now and could never go back to my old optical mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Laser Lights Out!!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has all the bells and whistles the tracking is perfect you can move anywhere on your monitor in about a 2 square inch area. The size and shape of the mouse keep your hand relaxed at all times. Recharging is only necessary about every two weeks (if that) even if you use it for a couple hours daily. This is a huge benefit as my previous mouse ate up batteries at a clop of about 4-8 a month. Scrolling is a breeze with side to side and up and down feature. If you are going to put out $30-40 bucks for a wireless mouse step up for the extra $20 it is WELL WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Radcliff

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I actually own two of these mice - one for home and one for work. They work great and you have so many more controls on it than you do on a basic mouse, and I love the no cord feature. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: H. Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these, one for my office, and one for home, and have been using both for about three weeks. They both operate perfectly, and I enjoy the freedom from the cable getting snagged under and around other items on my desk. I also like the recharge feature so I do not have to worry about replacement batteries. Over all, a very good addition to my computer systems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse, fast with a good feel and very reliable. Charges well on it's stand and is flexible with a variety of software.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E Court

customer_reviews.title: Solid Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse, has plenty of buttons but they are positioned so they dont get in your way. Its a good size for people with large hands and is comfortable for gaming, in fact the design is almost identical to Logitech's gaming mouse. It is very precise and has great battery life. There really isnt much bad I can say. I wouldnt pay [...] for a mouse but since I got it for [...] after all my [...] how can you go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick J. Dote

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this mouse with an iMac, and it runs circles around the mighty mouse that came with the computer. Fast, responsive, and easy to customize. Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Criden

customer_reviews.title: Buttons
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the button structure for this mouse. I love the laser and the weight. It has the application selector which I just find fantastic. The only downside is that it uses a HUB rather than a Mini-Reciever and its a little bulky. All around, a great mouse. And it arrived early.

product_meta.title: Logitech MX1000 Laser Cordless Mouse
product_meta.description: Includes: rapid-charging cradle, CD with SetPoint software, USB to PS/2 adapter, & AC power adapter. Logitech MX 1000 Laser Cordless Mouse - Computer mouse technology makes another giant leap with the MX 1000 from Logitech. Replacing the optical LED design of many mice on the market, it features a laser, for an amazing increase in accuracy and sensitivity. Up to 20 times more accurate in fact! That makes it a perfect fit with graphic professionals, gamers, and anyone who wants pinpoint accuracy on nearly any surface. The Logitech MX Laser Engine can handle almost anything - polished, wood-grain, fabric, and more!
